title.text: TKB-UO: Using Sense Clustering for WSD

abstractContent.text: This paper describes the clustering-based approach to Word Sense Disambiguation that is followed by the TKB-UO system at SemEval-2007.
The underlying disambigua-tion method only uses WordNet as external resource, and does not use training data.
Results obtained in both Coarse-grained En-glish all-words task (task 7) and English fine-grained all-words subtask (task 17) are presented.

introductionContent.text: The TKB-UO system relies on the knowledgedriven approach to Word Sense Disambiguation (WSD) presented in (Anaya-).

Regarding that meaningful senses of words in a textual unit must be coherently related, our proposal uses sense clustering with the aim of determining cohesive groups of senses that reflect the connectivity of the disambiguating words.
The way this proposal uses clustering for disambiguation purposes is different from those usages reported in other works of the WSD area.
For example, in) textual contexts are clustered in order to represent senses for Word Sense Discrimination.
Other works like, cluster fine-grained word senses into coarse-grained ones for polysemy reduction.
Instead, our method clusters all possible senses corresponding to all words in a disambiguating textual unit.
Thus, our system implements a novel clustering approach for the contextual disambiguation of words.
We use the lexical resource WordNet (version 2.1) as the repository of word senses, and also as the provider of sense representations.
It is worth mentioning that our proposal does not require the use of training data.
